turns.speaker: MURDOCK
turns.text: Sorry, Clarence. Latest weather report shows everything socked in from Salt Lake to Lincoln.

turns.speaker: OVEUR
turns.text: Hi, Roger. Good to have you aboard. Victor, this is Roger Murdock.

turns.speaker: OVEUR
turns.text: Roger.

turns.speaker: MURDOCK
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: OVEUR
turns.text: Roger.

turns.speaker: MURDOCK
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: MURDOCK
turns.text: We have clearance, Clarence.

turns.speaker: OVEUR
turns.text: Roger, Roger. What's our vector, Victor?

turns.speaker: MURDOCK
turns.text: Do you want me to check the weather, Clarence?

turns.speaker: OVEUR
turns.text: No, why don't you take care ot it?

turns.speaker: OVEUR
turns.text: No, he's not bothering anyone. Let him stay up here.

turns.speaker: MURDOCK
turns.text: All right. But just remember, my name is Roger Murdock.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Excuse me, Sister?

turns.speaker: SISTER ANGELINA
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: There's a little girl on board who's ill and...

turns.speaker: SISTER ANGELINA
turns.text: Oh yes, I saw. Poor child.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Could I borrow your guitar? I thought I might be able to cheer her up.

turns.speaker: SISTER ANGELINA
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Fourteen-B. It's halfway down on your right.

turns.speaker: STRIKER
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Do you feel all right, sir?

turns.speaker: STRIKER
turns.text: Oh -- I haven't flown for a long time.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Excuse me, sir. Would you like some coffee before we serve dinner?

turns.speaker: STRIKER
turns.text: No. No thank you.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Excuse me, sir. There's been a little problem in the cockpit and I was wondering...

turns.speaker: STRIKER
turns.text: The cockpit? What is it?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: It's the little room at the front of the plane where the pilots sit. But that's not important right now. The first officer is ill and the Captain would like someone with flying experience to help him with the radio. Do you know anything about planes?

turns.speaker: STRIKER
turns.text: Well, I flew in the war, but that was a long time ago. I wouldn't know anything about it.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Would you go up, please?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Mr. Striker, the passengers are ready.

turns.speaker: STRIKER
turns.text: Thank you, Randy. You better leave sweetheart. You might get hurt in here.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Oooh.  Hardball.  That sounds interesting.  Are you going to strike me?  You could tie me up and then do whatever you want with me... I've got my own ropes.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Does that cost extra or you throw them in?

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: You've got me all wrong.  I don't charge money for something that I myself find pleasurable...

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Look, I don't know where Mr. Strader might be.  He comes and he goes.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: The girl out front mentioned Strader's assistant, somebody named Watson.  Maybe he knows.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Todd?  Todd doesn't know either.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: I know... Why don't you hang around for a while, let me entertain you? It's Matt, right?  Now tell me the truth, have you ever... made it... with one of us?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Not unless I got real drunk and nobody told me about it later.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: A virgin.  I find that very arousing...

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: There's lots of things I haven't done, but his ain't high on the list.  Don't take it personally.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: I think you're just a little scared now, about what you might find once the lights go out.  A little scared... and a lot curious.  Maybe more than you want to admit.  But doesn't that turn you on, that curiosity and fear, swirling together?  Think of it as broadening your horizons.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: I like my horizons narrow.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Your voice is saying no, but your body is saying yes.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: You are Cassandra?

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: We are with the Police Department. This is Sergeant Sykes, and I am--

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Ss'ai k'ss?  Perfect.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: He's not here.  Why ask me?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: The young woman at the front said you might know where he is.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: She did, did she?  Well, she was wrong.  Excuse me, I have to change.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: In there.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Show me.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: So what've you got on Tuggle's killers?

turns.speaker: FEDORCHUK
turns.text: Jesus, Sykes -- it's been less than ten hours.  Me and Alterez are on it, okay?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: You don't have squat.

turns.speaker: FEDORCHUK
turns.text: You ever try to make a case in Slagtown?  The list of Newcomer informants is about as long as the list of Mexican war heroes...

turns.speaker: FEDORCHUK
turns.text: Look at your dildo partner.  He's too scared to even come down to the sand.  You're not gonna get wet standing here, moron!

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: I'd like to see you next to a sea of hydrochloric acid, Fedorchuk... see how much surfin' you'd do.

turns.speaker: FEDORCHUK
turns.text: Well, if it isn't Detective Jetson. Forget you hip waders, big guy?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Lay off, asshole.

turns.speaker: FEDORCHUK
turns.text: I may be an asshole, but at least I'm a real detective, not some outer shit space thing.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: William Harcourt?

turns.speaker: HARCOURT
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: I'm Sergeant Sykes, and this is Detective Jetson, Los Angeles Police Department.

turns.speaker: HARCOURT
turns.text: Sergeant... Detective.  I wasn't aware there were any Newcomers at the rank of Detective yet.

turns.speaker: HARCOURT
turns.text: Yes, I heard about poor Warren. Tragic.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: You were partners with him on some Slag -- uh, Newcomer real estate thing.

turns.speaker: HARCOURT
turns.text: That's right.  He and I, along with seven or eight others.  Listen, gentlemen, I will be happy to assist you in any way I can -- unfortunately, at the moment, I'm overdue at another function.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Move a finger, Harcourt, and you're history...

turns.speaker: HARCOURT
turns.text: No, Sergeant -- not history...  Eternity...

turns.speaker: KIPLING
turns.text: That cop, the human, he was the one who killed Anderson and the driver.

turns.speaker: HARCOURT
turns.text: This is becoming a serious breach of security.

turns.speaker: KIPLING
turns.text: He didn't recognize me.

turns.speaker: HARCOURT
turns.text: It is his new partner that I'm worried about.

turns.speaker: KIPLING
turns.text: When we picked him up, he was talking to those two cops -- the two who came to question you about Hubley.

turns.speaker: HARCOURT
turns.text: This is getting out of hand.  I want you to deal with it.  Immediately.

turns.speaker: HARCOURT
turns.text: Kill them both.

turns.speaker: KIPLING
turns.text: Here?

turns.speaker: HARCOURT
turns.text: Do it!

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: ... and we work my hours.  I'll do the driving, you do the paperwork. You gotta learn it so you might as well do it all.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Sergeant... I'd like to thank you for what you're doing.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: What's that?  Look, Jetson.  Get this straight in your head.  We're not pals, we're not married, and we ain't gonna take long moonlight walks together... We're just partners.  And don't call me Sergeant.  Call me Sykes... or Matt if you have to.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: I am George.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Man, somebody really hung one on you!  I've heard some good ones for you guys... Humphrey Bogart, Harley Davidson.  I guess the people at immigration got a little punchy after a while, coming up with names for a quarter of a million of you. You weren't at the back of the line, were you, George?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: My true name is Ss'tangya T'ssorentsa'.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Gesundheit.  You don't mind if I stick to George, do you?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Anyway, what's it matter to you if we think it's funny, right?  Whatta you care?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: That is exactly so.  It is like your name... Sykes.  I'm sure it doesn't bother you at all that it sounds like "ss'ai k'ss", two words in my language which mean "excrement" and "cranium".

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Let's talk Hubley.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: His body was discovered three days ago, in an alley off of Central Avenue, near downtown.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: With two BRI Sabot slugs in the chest.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Through the chest.  Rupturing both the primary and secondary hearts.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Nice signal, dickwad!

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Terrific.  A real pillar of the community.  Was Hubley missing anything when they found him?  Was he ripped off?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: There was no wallet... but he was still wearing a watch and two rings.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: The guys at the mini-mart last night made a half-assed stab at the money in the till -- but I don't think that's what they were there for.  I think we got us a couple'a executions on our hands, George...

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: The murder at the mini-mart is not our case.  The Captain said--

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Look, you want to fit in here, right?  You want to learn how to get along?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Well, there's a thing about partners, about being somebody's partner.  You do for each other. And other people's rules don't mean shit.  It's the rules set up between the two of you, that's all that counts.  Understand?  Okay.  Well, my friend and partner was shot last night and I'm after the shitbag that did it.  As my partner, I'm asking you to respect me and help me find him.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: What is wrong?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Nothing's wrong.  I just want to get something straight.  You agree that there's a good chance these two shootings are somehow related, right?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Well... yes, quite possibly.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Possibly.  Good.  Well, would you be willing to accept the theory, George, that... possibly... by examining the evidence from one case we might shed some small ray of light on the other?  Does that sound unreasonable to you?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Yes... no, it is not unreasonable. Although I--

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Great.  Well, I'm sure glad that's settled, aren't you?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: What's this?  What's going on?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Nothing?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Shouldn't we examine their personal effects?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: What is this?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: A rubber.  A condom.  You know... Coney Island whitefish?  Men, human men, put them on their, uh -- penises -- to protect against having babies.  You need this for anything?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Get the picture?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: And that fits?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Well... Yeah, it's rubber.  It stretches.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: And still it fits?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Newcomers working near methane gasses at oil refineries must paint it on their boots to protect against sparks.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: How the hell do you know that?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: A large number of my people were hired by refineries because the methane fumes are not harmful to us. My spouse's brother is one.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: So the Slag they're cutting into upstairs worked at a refinery just like Hubley worked at a refinery.  I'd say that "possible" connection between the two cases just got a hell of a lot more possible.  Okay, next step -- I gotta go talk to the wife of the Slag store owner blown away last night.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: I believe I should interview the widow alone.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Why the hell--?!  Great, fine.  You talk to the wife.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Mrs. Porter is not taking her husband's death well.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Did you learn anything?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: A week ago two men came to see her husband.  After they left, he was very frightened.  She identified one of the men from a photo I showed her.  It was Hubley.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Aw-right.  What about the other guy?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: She didn't know him.  But she said her son might.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Did you talk to him?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: He has not been home since that day. But she told me where to find him.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Rudyard Kipling?  No shit?  Listen, we just need a minute of your time...

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: We'd like to ask you about a business associate of your, Warren Hubley.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Why did you do it?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Why'd I do what?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Agree to work with me?  You don't like me... you don't like any of us. You have nothing but contempt for us.  And yet you become an outcast from your club of detectives by making me your partner...

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: My partner is dead!  Because one of you bastards killed him -- then disappeared into a rathole down in Slagtown, where he's home and dry, 'cause nobody sees nothing, nobody says nothing...

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Who said that?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: At the end of the bar.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Your name wouldn't happen to be Porter, would it?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Uh, Matthew...

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Back off, George.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: But I-- .

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: I'll handle it.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Screw you.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Screw me?  That can't be right.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Tell me.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Your mother mates out of season.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: That's very colorful.  But see -- now I've got a problem.  I don't seem to be getting much cooperation from you, Porter.  So I guess we're gonna have to take this little session down to my office, ya know?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Matthew, you don't have to-- .

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Stay back!  I'm okay.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: You know that guy?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: From quarantine, when my people first arrived here.  He and I were housed together.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: How could a straight-arrow like you ever pick a roommate like him?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: In the camps, we were lodged four to a room.  The selection process was entirely random.  We did not get to stay with our friends... or families...

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: If I may make a suggestion... We have different weak spots than you do.  Next time, a blow to the nerve plexus under the arm, here, will produce the effect I think you were looking for.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Yeah, sure.  I knew that...

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: I don't think I could ever learn to read that shit.  How long did it take you to learn English?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Three months.  We learn quickly.  We adapt.  It is our strength... what we were bred for, to adapt to hostile environments.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Which one is that?  Raw what?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: This is mole.  It's good.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: I'll bet.  Would it really put you out if they tossed that on the grill for a minute or two?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Our bodies do not assimilate the nutrients if the food has been cooked.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: So what was that other word for Human... Slow ka?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Ss'loka'.  It means literally "small but intelligent creature".  It loses much in the translation.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: And what was that one about my mother?  That was a good one.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Ss'trokya ss'lato 'na'.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Yeah, that's it.  Say it slow.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Who is he?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Todd Watson.  The assistant manager.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: We were chasing you because you ran, you dumb son-of-a-bitch.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: When will Strader return?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: I believe he is probably lying.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Through his ass.  Next time you see him, tell him to call me... unless you want us to keep coming back on you like a bad case of herpes.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: So, she keeps you on a pretty short leash, does she?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: My wife?  She worries about me.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Yeah... I know the routine.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: You are married?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Was.  Divorced.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: We mate for life.  Divorce... is a strange concept to us.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: It's like having an eleventh finger removed.  It hurts like hell, but you never really needed the damn thing in the first place.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Your home is quite disordered.  I thought perhaps you had been burglarized when I walked in.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: I appreciate your honesty, George.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Human children can be very beautiful.  Getting married?  Congratulations. You will be taking Sunday off, then...

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Maybe not... I don't know.  I'm not sure I'm gonna go.  She doesn't need her burn-out of a father there...

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: ... and so, and so the doctor says, "If this is the thermometer, then where'd I leave the pen?"  You're not... you don't think that's funny?  George, work with me, I always get a laugh with that one. Look, if the doctor's got the thermometer in his hand, then where's his pen gotta be?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: In the other man's rectum.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Sticking out of his ass... yeah! See, that's what makes it a joke. There's like a surprise, and your mind fills in the funny picture. Here's this guy with a pen stuck in his ass and he thinks it's a thermometer.  Nada, huh?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Your health...

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Ta ss'trakyona'...

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: There is so much our two peoples don't understand about each other.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: No shit, Holmes.  You're only from another goddamn planet, for chrissakes.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: You humans are very curious to us. You invite us to live among you, in an atmosphere of equality we've never known before.  You lay before us a beautiful green world, full of freedoms and opportunities... You give us ownership of our lives for the first time... and you ask no more of us than you do of yourselves: to live by the rules... rules that aren't made to keep one people subordinate to another, but rules that exist to preserve equality.  You aspire to very high ideals here.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: I hope you can understand how special your world is... how unique a people you humans are.  So it us all the more painful and confusing to us that so few of you seem capable of living up the the ideals you set for yourselves.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Don't count on me, George.  I never had any ideals.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: I'm going home.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Yeah, go home.  Get some sleep.  You do sleep, don't you?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Where'd you get this?!!

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: A man, a human, was wiring it to your car.  I didn't get a good look at him.  I must call my wife...

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: She's going to divorce me.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: George, she's not gonna divorce you. You mate for life, remember?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: She's very progressive.  I'm certain she's considering it.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Well, let's roll, George.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: To the... to the beach?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Come on, let's go, dude.  Surf's up!

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Stop the car.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Please, I must get out here.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Come on, you won't have to get near the water.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Stop the car!

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: It's all right, George.  It's cool. Just wait here, all right?  I'll be back in a coupla minutes.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: What was that about?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: ... So we've got three guys dead. All Newcomers, all killed the same way -- execution style.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Warren Hubley was in middle management at a refinery... Joshua Strader operated a successful bar and nightclub...

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: ... and Porter ran a piece of shit mom-and-pop mini-mart.  So what the hell's the connection?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: What's this nothing shit?  It wasn't nothing yesterday when you asked Bentner to run that test and he looked like he was about to shit peach pits, and it's not nothing now.  Don't lie to me, George, you're bad at it.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: You must leave me alone on this.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: No secrets, goddammit!  You don't hold back from me.  Whatever is going on, you're gonna tell me now!

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: No.  I cannot involve you.  This is not your concern.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: The hell it isn't, when somebody wires up enough C-4 explosive to my car to turn me into pink mist!  That Slag was on something, and not sour milk, either?  Am I right?  TELL ME!  What is it?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: ... It is called ss'jabroka'.  To us it is a potent narcotic.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: How potent?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Like your cocaine, I suppose.  The "high" lasts several hours.  We would receive small amounts of it... as a reward for our labor.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: We?  You've taken it?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: We all did.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Where did he get it?  Was there any of it on the ship?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: No... I am sure not.  That is why I am so concerned... someone must now be producing it here.  But none of my people know how to make it.  The process was carefully guarded.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Jesus, this is major.  Why didn't you tell me sooner? Why'd you hold out on me?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Your people don't know about this part of out past.  And they can't know -- It would threaten our entire existence here.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: George... look me in the eye... George, you don't ever lie to me again.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: I must trust you, Matthew.  I cannot stop this without you.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: They had months in quarantine to develop the plan.  Porter, with his chemistry background, must have somehow come up with the formula for the drug.  Hubley manufactured it -- at the refinery.  Strader, through the nightclub, established a distribution network.  And Harcourt--

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Harcourt was the brain who brought it all together.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Okay, George -- we gotta play this real smart.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: If the drug is here, we must destroy it.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: No, George -- you're missing the point.  The drug is evidence.  We need to have the evidence, ya know?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Uh, George...

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Where is the drug?  Where have they taken it?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: George, uh... you're gonna break his little chest bones...

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Stay out of this, Matthew.  Tell me where the drug has been taken or I will crush your lungs against this wall.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: George, c'mon -- lighten up.  It's a beauty of a case.  Don't sweat it -- we got him by the short hairs. He ain't gonna make any more of the shit.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: The fifty kilos, Matthew.  I have to find it.  I can't let it get out on the street.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Why?  What's the big goddamn deal?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Fuck procedure.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Ss-ai!

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: With Harcourt and Kipling dead, I assume you will be requesting reassignment now.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: It'd be for your own good.  I think you'd be better off with a partner who's a little more... by the book.  ... Still, I gotta tell you, George, for a quiet guy, you're sure hell on wheels once you get going.  I'd kinda hate to miss your next two days as a detective.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: What's this about, George?  I know that look.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: There!  Go back.  Down that side street.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: No!  We must do this alone.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Do what?!  George-- ?!

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: What is this?!

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: ... It's Harcourt.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Harcourt is dead.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: No he's not.  Not if he overdosed on the drug.  Massive amounts trigger a... a change.  Your body functions seize up, you appear to be dead, but it's really a state of incubation.  When you emerge you're...

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Tell me about it...

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: I never thought I'd say this, but -- for once in my life I think I'm willing to wait for back-up.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: We can't let him get away.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Why the hell are you so dead set against back-up?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: Because... because of what will happen if humans see what we are capable of becoming.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: But there's no more drug.

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: You understand that.  But how many others will?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: How do I look?

turns.speaker: JETSON
turns.text: You look very good.

turns.speaker: MAFFET
turns.text: You said you wanted the biggest thing I could find... Well, this is it.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: MAFFET
turns.text: Casull .454 Magnum.  You're talking twice the impact energy of .44 Magnum hot loads.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Only holds five.

turns.speaker: MAFFET
turns.text: Yeah, the shells are too big for six in an cylinder.  Hell, Matt, you don't need but one.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: No... two.

turns.speaker: O'NEAL
turns.text: Mr. Hubley was an all right guy -- and a damn good manager.  The men liked him.  I'm really gonna have to scramble to fill his shoes.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Well, one of the men didn't like him so much...

turns.speaker: O'NEAL
turns.text: You think this is the guy who did it?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: We think he could'a been involved, yeah.  You know him?

turns.speaker: O'NEAL
turns.text: To be honest, it's hard to say.  I hate to admit it but -- they all still kinda look alike to me.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Who else can I ask around here?

turns.speaker: O'NEAL
turns.text: Wait.  You know who it looks like? Yeah.  Anderson.  Uh... James Anderson.  He isn't in today.  He took the afternoon off.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: I think you're gonna find he's taken the rest of his life off.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: That where Anderson worked?

turns.speaker: O'NEAL
turns.text: Yes it is.  Thirty-five percent pure Methane gas in there.  I don't know how these fellas do it.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Don't piss him off, O'Neal.  When he gets like this, I can't control him. I've seen this before.  He got like this once -- I saw him jerk a guy's spine out and show it to him. Nothing I could do.  I hadda go throw up.

turns.speaker: O'NEAL
turns.text: ... They took the stuff out, all of it -- this afternoon.

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: Here's Hubley.  Left Quarantine on November thirtieth, relocated first to Riverside, then moved to Los Angeles early in February the following year.  Field of expertise: chemical manufacturing.  Looks like he passed up several other better paying jobs waiting for that one at the refinery.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Try Joshua Strader, will ya, darlin'?

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: For you, anything.

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: Released December one.  He and his wife moved first to Modesto, then Coalinga, California -- wherever that is -- settled in L.A. in April.  Field of expertise: organic chemical engineering.  He and his wife have one child, a son.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Yeah -- we met him.  Wonderful boy... close personal friend of George's here.

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: I'm sorry, Matt.  Nothing here seems to be matching up...

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Can you dig up their Quarantine records in this thing?

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: Sure.  Just a minute.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Jesus, are the questions too tough for you already?  Let's try again--  Is your name Porter?

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Ss'kya'ta'.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: One of the two men was Hubley, right?  What about the other one? Did you know him?

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Yeah... I seen him around.  High- roller dude named Strader.  Joshua Strader.  Runs a club on the west side.  Encounters.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Yeah, I heard of it.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: That's all I know.  You want anything more, you ask somebody else.
